content: teeny-weeny whale by emkatcrochet this little cutie is fun quick and easy to make ©2020 emkatcrochet *you may sell the finished items provided you give the credit to emkatcrochet helen smith- designer *you may not sell or share the pattern don t forget to tag me in your makes #emkatcrochet #littleleggys what you ll need 3mm crochet hook scrap yarn no bigger than dk unless you change hook accordingly in any main colour of your choice white and black scissors stuffing tapestry/wool needle abbreviations magic_ring magic_ring chain chain slip_stitch slip_stitch single_crochet single_crochet picot picot see special stitches below increase 2 stitches in the same stitch sts number of stitches at the end of the round blo back loop only decrease decrease stitch pattern pattern written in us terms notes the whale is worked in the round anything in work as many times as stated special stitch picot - chain 3 slip_stitch into 3rd chain from the hook round 7 will work the whale s tail and fins the tail part will be worked all into 1 stitch round 8 will be the first white round for the bottom of the whale and is worked in the back loop only you also need to miss the back of the tail and fins whale in your main colour choice start with a magic_ring round 1 6sc into the ring pull tight 6 sts round 2 single_crochet increase x 6 12 sts round 3 1sc 1sc increase x 6 18 sts round 4 6 18sc round 18 sts ©2020 emkatcrochet *you may sell the finished items provided you give the credit to emkatcrochet helen smith- designer *you may not sell or share the pattern don t forget to tag me in your makes #emkatcrochet #littleleggys round 7 see notes - 1sc *ch5 3rd chain from the hook 3dc slip_stitch** repeat from * to ** one more time to finish the tail 5sc picot slip_stitch into last single_crochet just made 7sc picot slip_stitch into last single_crochet just made 5sc 18 sts see below change to white round 8 see notes - blo 1sc decrease x 6 12 sts see below here you need to embroider your eyes i did mine just in front of each fin in a v shape see pics below also stuff your whale here ©2020 emkatcrochet *you may sell the finished items provided you give the credit to emkatcrochet helen smith- designer *you may not sell or share the pattern don t forget to tag me in your makes #emkatcrochet #littleleggys round 9 decrease x 6 6 sts break yarn and close opening sew any loose ends in ta da you have made a teeny-weeny whale hope you enjoyed making you whale please feel free to tag me in your makes on facebook or instagram @emkatcrochet 😊 ©2020 emkatcrochet *you may sell the finished items provided you give the credit to emkatcrochet helen smith- designer *you may not sell or share the pattern don t forget to tag me in
